text: I think there’s been a shift in the GOP in the last 30 yrs (HW Bush v. Trump) and there’s evidence that donor $ played a role when you look at how the GOP primary candidates visit Adelson, make speeches at RJC etc. My main point is it’s weird to call the mere idea of that “ugly”
author: JustinElliott

text: I just don't get how you can say in a news article that the idea that donors have influence over policy is "ugly"when Trump's #1 donor says "I’m a one-issue person. That issue is Israel"
author: JustinElliott

text: I think there's strong ideological elements and also donor/financial elements -- I and a bunch of others have outlined Adelson role, for example https://features.propublica.org/trump-inc-podcast/sheldon-adelson-casino-magnate-trump-macau-and-japan/ … https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/06/us/politics/trump-embassy-jerusalem-israel.html …

text:
4/7 The FDA says it removed the tobacco products from review to better allocate resources, but anti-smoking groups have been critical. One said it raised “troubling questions.”

https://www.fda.gov/NewsEvents/Newsroom/FDAInBrief/ucm603775.htm …
author: JustinElliott

text:
3/7 The FDA had been doing public-health assessments of hundreds of tobacco products, deciding which would have to be pulled from the market. The agency said last week it is dropping hundreds of products from review. 

About 50 are cigarette brands from Lorber’s company.
author: JustinElliott

text:
2/7 Lorber is CEO of Vector Group, the parent of tobacco firms Liggett and Vector Tobacco. (His company is better known for owning NYC brokerage Douglas Elliman.) 

Lorber regularly speaks to Trump on the phone, according to CNBC.
author: JustinElliott

text: 1/7 I recently came across something: Trump’s FDA just delivered a significant win for cigarette makers and for one of the president’s longtime friends and donors, Howard Lorber.
